summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Alison J. Nathan notifying the court of a superseding indictment (S2) in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the new charges, which extend the timeline of the alleged conspiracies to 2004 and add a fourth minor victim (Minor Victim-4), and addresses the impact on discovery, trial preparation, and pending motions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, charged with multiple counts related to enticing minors to travel, transporting minors, and sex trafficking conspiracies.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, to whom this notification letter is addressed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submitted this letter to the court.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the central figure in the investigation whose associates are also being investigated; his case is the source of witness statements.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, involved in the conspiracies under investigation.
The S2 indictment alleges Maxwell participated in sex trafficking and other crimes against Minor Victim-4 between approximately 2001 and 2004.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is representing the government in the prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Superseding Indictment Returned
events.description: A grand jury in Manhattan returned a superseding indictment (S2) against Ghislaine Maxwell, adding new charges and extending the timeline of alleged conspiracies.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to proceed on this date, as referenced in the government's letter.

events.title: Alleged Crimes Against Minor Victim-4
events.description: The new charges in the S2 indictment allege that the conspiracy to entice and transport minors, and a sex trafficking conspiracy, continued through this period, with Minor Victim-4 as a victim.

events.title: Planned Witness Statement Production
events.description: The government intended to begin production of statements from over 250 non-testifying witnesses related to the Epstein investigation by this date.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A superseding indictment (S2) was filed, extending the alleged conspiracy timeline from ending in 1997 to continuing through approximately 2004.
The new indictment adds a fourth minor victim, referred to as Minor Victim-4, who was allegedly victimized between 2001 and 2004.
Two new charges were added: Count Five (sex trafficking conspiracy) and Count Six (sex trafficking of a minor), both related to Minor Victim-4.
The government stated its investigation remained ongoing but did not intend to seek further indictments if the trial proceeded as scheduled on July 12, 2021.
The superseding indictment, returned by a grand jury in Manhattan, rendered moot a defense motion to dismiss based on the prior use of a grand jury in White Plains.
